conclusion: Analyze the flow path of the liquid from each inlet to the outlets.
Inlet A: Liquid flows from the top left, downward and to the right, passing through yellow and green baffles.
Inlet B: Liquid flows from the top center, downward and to the right, passing through green and cyan baffles.
Inlet C: Liquid flows from the top right, downward and to the left, passing through cyan and gray baffles.
Inlet D: Liquid flows from the top right, downward and to the left, passing through cyan and gray baffles.
Baffles direct flow from top to bottom, right or left depending on baffle position.
Flow from inlets A and B directed more towards the right.
Flow from inlets C and D directed more towards the left.
Inlet A: Liquid will flow into container F.
Inlet B: Liquid will flow into container F.
Inlet C: Liquid will flow into container E.
Inlet D: Liquid will flow into container E.
Liquid from inlets A and B will flow into container F; liquid from inlets C and D will flow into container E.
